item.title: In Istanbul, Pope Leo calls for unity between the eastern and western churches
item.description: Pope Leo visits Istanbul's Blue Mosque and celebrates mass as he calls for peace and unity among Christians and Muslims.

item.title: Catholic nuns in Wisconsin return land bought in 1966 to an Indigenous tribe
item.description: Franciscan nuns in Wisconsin transferred their land to the Lac du Flambeau tribe, believed to be the first such "land return" by a Catholic group in the U.S.

item.title: Pope's visit to Lebanon sparks hope but also frustration
item.description: As Pope Leo prepares to visit northern Lebanon, Christian border villages in the south feel abandoned and struggle to rebuild after the war with Israel.

item.title: Pope Leo's Lebanon visit sparks frustration as he'll skip the most battered region
item.description: Pope Leo visits war-torn Lebanon but some in the country with the biggest percentage of Christians in the region are upset he's skipping the most battered part.

item.title: Pope Leo prays for unity at historic Nicaea site
item.description: On the second day of his inaugural overseas trip, Pope Leo XIV visited the ancient site of the First Council of Nicaea, in Turkey, urging Christians — and all faiths — to reject the use of religion to justify violence.
item.content:encoded:
On the second day of his inaugural overseas trip, Pope Leo XIV visited the ancient site of the First Council of Nicaea, in Turkey, urging Christians — and all faiths — to reject the use of religion to justify violence.

(Image credit: Chris McGrath)

item.description: This Thanksgiving, Pope Leo is making his first overseas trip as pontiff. He started in Turkey, where he called for tolerance between different peoples and religions.
